articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Parisa Hafezi, Jeff Mason
articles.description: Before leaving for the world leaders summit, U.S. President Donald Trump said, "I hope there's going to be a deal."
articles.title: Israel-Iran battle escalates, will be high on agenda as world leaders meet

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Tom Polansek
articles.description: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz said a 57-year-old suspect was arrested on Sunday in the killing of a Democratic state lawmaker and her husband while posing as a police officer.
articles.title: U.S. police arrest suspect in Minnesota lawmakers' shooting

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Hatem Khaled
articles.description: Israeli fire killed at least 40 people, half of them near an aid distribution site operated by the U.S.-backed Gaza Humanitarian Foundation on Monday, the territory's health ministry said, as U.N. officials denounced Israeli-backed aid delivery methods.
articles.title: 40 killed in Gaza, many trying to reach food, as UN denounces Israeli-backed aid system

articles.author: David Ljunggren, John Irish, Andreas Rinke
articles.description: Leaders from the Group of Seven nations begin annual talks amid wars in Ukraine and the Middle East that add to global economic uncertainty, as host Canada tries to avoid a clash with President Donald Trump.
articles.title: Seeking unity, G7 meets amid escalating Ukraine, Middle East conflicts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: France has shut down the four main Israeli company stands at the Paris Airshow for apparently displaying offensive weapons, in a move condemned by Israel that highlights the growing tensions between the traditional allies.
articles.title: Israel furious as France shuts four weapons stands at Paris Airshow

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A federal judge is set to consider whether to extend an order blocking President Donald Trump's plan to bar foreign nationals from entering the United States to study at Harvard University.
articles.title: Harvard to urge judge to bar Trump from closing doors for international students

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations on Monday slashed its aid appeal to donors by over a third, saying it was now seeking $29 billion to support 114 million people amid what it described as the deepest funding cuts ever.
articles.title: UN cuts aid appeal after donors slash budgets

articles.author: Riham Alkousaa
articles.description: A German court sentenced a Syrian doctor found guilty of torturing dissidents in Syria to life in prison on Monday, local media reported, the latest win for victims of the Assad regime under universal jurisdiction rules.
articles.title: Germany hands Syrian doctor life for torturing dissidents, media report

articles.author: Layli Foroudi, Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: Hichem Miraoui, a 45-year-old Tunisian barber, was at home in the south of France late in May, chatting on the phone with his mother and sisters, when a neighbour drove past and shot him dead on his doorstep.
articles.title: A far-right inspired murder forces France to wrestle with what counts as terrorism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Extreme hunger is intensifying in 13 global hot spots, with Gaza, Sudan, South Sudan, Haiti and Mali at immediate risk of famine without urgent humanitarian intervention, a joint United Nations report warned on Monday.
articles.title: Hunger crisis deepens in global hotspots as famine risk rises, UN warns
